item.description:

Into the Jungle Read More »

The post Into the Jungle appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Hey, I can’t tell how deep I’m in. I mean,
I’ve been unmessing the mess I’ve been
But at times I feel like I’m in a dense green
Trekkin’ within with no sense of direction

“Oh, but why?” They ask. They always ask…because they don’t understand, I guess. It’s simple — we are all wired differently, and even with all worldly knowledge, wisdom does linger.

Depression and mental health are such ugly words for society. Perhaps, that’s also why people don’t discuss them as much as physical ailments. Or care for them unless a tragedy strikes. But, the truth of the matter is that our brain is a complex thing for us humans to comprehend, even when it’s our own. Also, it can be quite heavy, if not the heaviest thing on the planet.

So for those uninitiated who wonder, “Oh, but why?” Here’s an analogy — Depression can be like getting lost in a dense forest without GPS or compass. Like every other decision in life, you won’t even know when you veered off the trail. Once you do get lost, it’s like all your meticulous plans go for a toss.

You feel disoriented in the tangle of trees and bushes, wandering and cluelessly circling at one spot. It can be a dreadful and unsettling feeling to find yourself astray, cut off from the outside world.

Even if someone calls and guides you from the outside, you don’t know if you’ll make it. Your own creative brain plays its trickery, painting things grim than they probably are.

So don’t wander off into the wilderness as you don’t understand the depth of it. Your only recourse is to stay put. Share where you are and hopefully, somebody will come and get you. Until then just breathe, and look to the skies for a bigger picture.

Vasan

We all are aberrant from the ways of this world in one way or another | Sub-Editor at Smartprix.com

The post Into the Jungle appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: I Killed a Rapist
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Hey mom, I just killed a rapist An ape shit not meant to exist So I axed one off the hell’s hex list His own mum won’t miss him a bit Hey mom, you may insist killing is illicit But ill as it is, just like he didn’t resist I too did not desist instead …

I Killed a Rapist Read More »

The post I Killed a Rapist appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Hey mom, I just killed a rapist
An ape shit not meant to exist
So I axed one off the hell’s hex list
His own mum won’t miss him a bit

Hey mom, you may insist killing is illicit
But ill as it is, just like he didn’t resist
I too did not desist instead I fixed it
With my flaming fist and raging wrist

Hey mom, I rekt it n’ the world won’t split
cuz pure excuse for a man got his dick slit
Hell I could just sit n’ spit on his evil spirit
Then forget it until you or my girl’s in the mix

Hey mom, but you know I couldn’t I wouldn’t
I would end the world unto all life’s descend
If something happened; so I’ll fight and fend
Till my strong brethren’s weak minds mend

Vasan

We all are aberrant from the ways of this world in one way or another | Sub-Editor at Smartprix.com

The post I Killed a Rapist appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Salvation
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Stuck within my skin Some sacred sins spin While I muse in my mellow blues I’m all loose letting my worries snooze The whiskey falls free on the rocks To open locks of my closed pandora box And the night witnesses my soul on fire as I smoke up my burning inner desire Only a shadow follows the …

Salvation Read More »

The post Salvation appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Stuck within my skin
Some sacred sins spin

While I muse in my mellow blues
I’m all loose letting my worries snooze

The whiskey falls free on the rocks
To open locks of my closed pandora box

And the night witnesses my soul on fire
as I smoke up my burning inner desire

Only a shadow follows the lone walker
Who knows I ain’t much of a talker

So while I chain smoke all worldly shit
To find some logic and link to fit

I could be doing lines while writing lines
Hoping to find salvation sometimes

Some silence is all I will borrow
And the art will thrive in the solitude and Sorrow

Vasan

We all are aberrant from the ways of this world in one way or another | Sub-Editor at Smartprix.com

The post Salvation appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Insomnia
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Whilst light sleeps into the night I let go of my dreary day’s fight Floating free upon the waves of the mat I shush my mind picturing this and that No more untangling the messy knots The night’s free from my fussy thoughts If I’m unsure of the day being wrong or right I just …

Insomnia Read More »

The post Insomnia appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Whilst light sleeps into the night
I let go of my dreary day’s fight

Floating free upon the waves of the mat
I shush my mind picturing this and that

No more untangling the messy knots
The night’s free from my fussy thoughts

If I’m unsure of the day being wrong or right
I just pass it onto the next twilight to decide

Still some nights, the shades are darker
As if the angelic moon also went farther

I would be torn between the hells of past
And a heavenly future from my mind cast

Gladly in the darkest of such grim nights
My mind shoots to astronomical heights

And amidst the state of wake and slumber
I trip to a dreamy realm, my vault of wonder

Vasan

We all are aberrant from the ways of this world in one way or another | Sub-Editor at Smartprix.com

The post Insomnia appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Worlds Apart
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
A being from outer space Was on a cosmic chase To match the rhythm of a heart That he felt from galaxies apart Thus he left on an endearing quest To get everything off his chest He wished to recite his heart’s story About his world in all its glory A world out there in …

Worlds Apart Read More »

The post Worlds Apart appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
A being from outer space
Was on a cosmic chase
To match the rhythm of a heart
That he felt from galaxies apart
Thus he left on an endearing quest
To get everything off his chest

He wished to recite his heart’s story
About his world in all its glory
A world out there in the skies
Where Eden garden lies

And one day,
Two spirits from different worlds
Met and with hope, a story unfurls

His eyes couldn’t embrace
The encounter of her gaze
It was like a heavenly sign
As if stars aligned in a line
Spellbound by her grace
He lost his voice to praise

With a promise of a la la land
He tried to reach out his hand

Suddenly, everything blacked out
As time and space withered about
Only when he saw the reality fade
He realized they were in a parallel space

Still worlds apart!

Vasan

We all are aberrant from the ways of this world in one way or another | Sub-Editor at Smartprix.com

The post Worlds Apart appeared first on Aberrance.
